column4: using the live cd go into system -> administrator -> partition editor and unflag the ntfs for boot.
Thanks efirewic1 - I'll do that and come back if there's another snag!
good luck
chaostheory: did you install any packages for gstreamer?
chaostheory: goto system -> administrator -> synaptic pack -> search for gstream and check for install, then apply.
chaostheory: and...
chaostheory: where are you getting this error again?
chaostheory: double click on the speaker icon
chaostheory: gotcha
chaostheory: when did this stop working?
chaostheory: do you have the alsa-base package installed?
chaostheory: go back into synaptic and search under sound or asla.
alsa
sorry
chaostheory: click on it and mark it for re-installation. then apply
chaostheory: I would try to re-install your volume control. go to applications - add/remove
chaostheory: then re-install, and reboot.
chaostheory: by the way what is the model pc your are using?
chaostheory: yes

- I unflagged NTFS for boot and still got the same error message when I went to browse the drive.  I'm wondering if it'll just be easier for me to take the drive out and throw it in the computer I'm currently using to get the files I need
might be.
